page.title: 16THE RIDGEWAY - HUNNINGHAM.
page.content: { The Ridgeway}is an ancient track or{green lane}running between{Ufton and{Hunningham.}It is well defined throughout its length. It crosses the{Grand Union Canal}and a number of roads including the{Welsh Road before coming out onto the{Fosse Way. Apart from the portion near{Ufton, which is hilly, its gradient is gently undulating and its outlook pleasant throughout. { The northern portion of the Ridgeway, from the once gated road to Long Itchington on to Hunningham is well marked through open fields both arable and pasture in use.{Horses}and some {sheep}graze in the pastures. { The Manpower Services Commission,}in 1985, began restoration work on the path, filling in holes and replacing the many dead elm trees with a species resistant to Dutch Elm Disease.
